results.title: Panic time
results.brief_description: This slow build suspenseful short efficiently builds anticipation through a series of very polished point-of-view shots The scene is set with a mysterious girl in an anonymous hotel room.

results.title: Tom Olsson's Cohuna
results.brief_description: Cohuna - When Cohuna Higher Elementary School wanted to raise money for a film projector in 1952, local resident Tom Olsson decided to help by filming life in the township and surrounding countryside, and then showing the footage in the local Town Hall. His footage has been lovingly compiled by the Cohuna Historical Society and the resulting film give us a special glimpse into rural life in 1950’s Victoria. The school recieved their projector, and Olsson’s films were shown annually as a Christmas treat for many years afterward.

results.title: World without end [exhibition work compliation]
results.brief_description:
“World without end” was an exhibition held in ACMI Screen Gallery Exhibition, 14 April 2005 - 17 July 2005. See the Exhibition activity record for more information.

Our experience of the world is shaped by the subtle and dramatic forces of nature, the energies and rhythms of cities, and the elastic time of global travel and instant communication networks.

This exhibition reveals how we perceive the world through an endless series of flows and flux: cycles of night and day, constantly changing weather patterns, crossings through natural and urban environments, currents of memory, emotion and reflection.

Descend into the Screen Gallery, a unique exhibition space tunnelling the length of Federation Square, to experience the world through a range of alternate lenses: everyday occurrences and familiar places seem strangely new and newly strange.

results.title: Weirdo
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
The story of a ‘weirdo’ guy, who’s best friend is a bird. They shop together and and live in harmony, until the ‘weirdo’ guy’s evil twin brother steals the bird. ‘Weirdo’ guy goes in pursuit of his evil twin brother up a mountain in a desperate attempt to save his best friend. A struggle ensues and, whilst ‘Weirdo’ manages to save his best friend, alas, his evil twin brother falls to his death off the mountain edge.

results.title: A Short film
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This short work features a lonely boy dealing with the pain of peer pressure, abuse by fellow students and the depression he suffers as a result. It continues on until he can’t cope with it any longer and writes a suicide note in his diary. He goes to the uppermost floor of a skyscraper and meets a lonely girl up there - seemingly suffering the same feelings. Together they jump into the abyss below.

results.title: Directors of the future
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A ‘mokumentary’ following the trials and tribulations of future ‘Star Director’ Izabella Dazs’ career. We begin the film as she is formulating an idea for her film and we finish by seeing her end product, “Les pommes du mal”.

results.title: Sadness
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A short animated piece, describing, in pictures and words, a girl’s sadness and feelings of isolation.

results.title: Detention
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
Four students are being kept in detention for one hour after school. They are bored and cannot wait to be allowed to leave. The clock ticks slowly on. Finally the clock strikes four and they are free to go.

results.title: The good, the bad and the animated
results.brief_description: A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival. This animated homage to Sergio Leone has the classic western ‘shootout’, between a cowboy in black and a cowboy in white. This town ain’t big enough for the both of them.
